content:
• Tuesday, October 18, 2011
  • FSII

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII) posts a mixed FQ4 earnings report. Its EPS came in at $0.05,...

    FSI International (NASDAQ:FSII) posts a mixed FQ4 earnings report. Its EPS came in at $0.05, below Street EPS estimates of $0.07, but sales came in at $30M, beating expectations for $28M. The stock initially slipped 5% after hours but has rebounded sharply since. Shares +5.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM
  • AAPL

    Several iPhone component suppliers are taking a hit following Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ4 report,...

    Several iPhone component suppliers are taking a hit following Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ4 report, in which iPhone shipments came in below Street forecasts. BRCM -1.7%. QCOM -1.9%. TQNT -4.1%. CRUS -4.2%. GLW -1.2%. OVTI -1.2%. Some other wireless industry players are also selling off: SNDK -1.2%. GOOG -0.8%. S -2.1%. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Eric Savitz's advice to everyone shocked over Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) rare earnings miss: Don't...

    Eric Savitz's advice to everyone shocked over Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) rare earnings miss: Don't panic. He believes the company line that customers were holding back on buying new iPhones in anticipation of the next version. Don't overlook that Apple also provided bullish Dec. quarter guidance, as people snap up the iPhone 4S. Can you say buying opportunity? AAPL -6.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM | 34 Comments
  • AAPL

    Mentioned during Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ4 call: China sales +270% Y/Y, now 12% of revenue;...

    Mentioned during Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ4 call: China sales +270% Y/Y, now 12% of revenue; Brazil +118%. $1.5B in iTunes sales. Gross margin expected to be "relatively flat" Q/Q. Retail sales up only 1% Y/Y due to soft iPhone sales. Tim Cook says Apple wants to "maintain flexibility" with its cash, but is "not religious" about holding it. AAPL -6.7% AH. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • SONC

    Sonic's (NASDAQ:SONC) FQ4 misses estimates as the drive-in restaurant chain saw its sales...

    Sonic's (NASDAQ:SONC) FQ4 misses estimates as the drive-in restaurant chain saw its sales decline once again. Earnings came in at $0.20 on revenue of $151M, down from analysts estimates of $0.22 per share on $153M. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • LLTC

    More on Linear Technology's (NASDAQ:LLTC) FQ1 results: The company expects FQ2 revenue to...

    More on Linear Technology's (NASDAQ:LLTC) FQ1 results: The company expects FQ2 revenue to decline 9%-13% sequentially, compared with forecasts for 2% growth. Linear blames the weakness on inventory corrections, and end-demand weakness in the industrial and communications markets. LLTC -3.2% AH. Rival TXN is down 1.6%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • PWAV

    Powerwave (NASDAQ:PWAV) is now down 32.2% AH thanks to its massive Q3 warning. A couple of its...

    Powerwave (NASDAQ:PWAV) is now down 32.2% AH thanks to its massive Q3 warning. A couple of its customers are also lower on the news. ERIC -2.2%. ALU -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • JNPR

    More on Juniper's (NYSE:JNPR) Q3 results: The company expects Q4 revenue of $1.16B-$1.22B and...

    More on Juniper's (NYSE:JNPR) Q3 results: The company expects Q4 revenue of $1.16B-$1.22B and EPS of $0.32-$0.36, largely below a consensus of $1.23B and $0.36. 8.9M shares repurchased during quarter. Service provider sales +8% Y/Y, enterprise sales +11%. Switch/router sales +12%, security hardware sales +1%. JNPR +1.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • HA

    Shares of Hawaiian Airlines (NASDAQ:HA) move up 12% AH after the carrier beats earnings...

    Shares of Hawaiian Airlines (NASDAQ:HA) move up 12% AH after the carrier beats earnings estimates by $0.14 on Q3 revenue of $456M (+30%). Passenger revenue miles increased 14% Y/Y, while HA's load factor decreased 1.7%. The company issues a positive outlook saying, "we have not seen a waning in forward bookings."
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • ISRG

    More on Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q3 beats across the board on a 30% Y/Y rise in...

    More on Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG): Q3 beats across the board on a 30% Y/Y rise in revenue, driven by strong sales of its da Vinci surgery system. The surgical robots are extensively used for cancer-treating surgeries such as hysterectomies and prostate removal, and continue to see strong demand. Shares +7.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • URI

    More on United Rentals' (NYSE:URI) Q3 report: Rental revenue $604M (+19% Y/Y). Forecasts rental...

    More on United Rentals' (NYSE:URI) Q3 report: Rental revenue $604M (+19% Y/Y). Forecasts rental rates will increase 6% for the full year. Expects full-year time utilization to increase by 3 percentage points. Maintains free cash flow guidance of $5M-$10M. Shares +10.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • AAPL

    More on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ4: $5.4B in cash generated during quarter, bringing total...

    More on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ4: $5.4B in cash generated during quarter, bringing total cash/investments balance to $81.6B. Sales to Americas fell 5% Q/Q (though up 34% Y/Y); Europe +4% Q/Q and +36% Y/Y; Asia-Pac +139% Y/Y. Notebook sales rose 44% Y/Y, compared with just 14% growth in FQ3. However, desktop sales rose only 1%. AAPL -6.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM | 2 Comments
  • AAPL

    More on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ4 results: 17.1M iPhones shipped vs. 22M consensus (main reason...

    More on Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) FQ4 results: 17.1M iPhones shipped vs. 22M consensus (main reason for shortfall). 11.1M iPads vs. 10M. 4.89M Macs vs. 4.5M. 6.62M iPods vs. 6.9M. Apple forecasts FQ1 revenue of $37B vs. $36.63B consensus; EPS of $9.30 vs. $8.96. AAPL -5.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 4 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ4 EPS of $7.05 misses by $0.23. Revenue of $28.3B (+39% Y/Y) misses by...

    Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL): FQ4 EPS of $7.05 misses by $0.23. Revenue of $28.3B (+39% Y/Y) misses by $1.15B. AAPL -5.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 25 Comments
  • PWAV

    Base station component maker Powerwave Technologies (NASDAQ:PWAV) warns Q3 revenue will be in a...

    Base station component maker Powerwave Technologies (NASDAQ:PWAV) warns Q3 revenue will be in a range of $75M-$79M, far below a consensus of $168.4M. The company blames weakness in both North America and international markets, and a "reduction in activity" with the company's OEM customers. Shares are (unsurprisingly) halted AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • CREE

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ1 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $269M (+.2% Y/Y) in-line....

    Cree (NASDAQ:CREE): FQ1 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $269M (+.2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -0.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • INTC

    More on Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) record quarter: Double-digit unit growth in notebooks. Gross...

    More on Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) record quarter: Double-digit unit growth in notebooks. Gross margin of 64.4%, down 1.7 points Y/Y. Operating income of $5.1B, up 22%. Expects Q4 revenue of $14.2B-$15.2B vs. $14.3B expected. Units: PC Client Group revenues up 22% to $9.4B; Data Center up 15% to $2.5B. Other architectures up 68%. Shares now +3.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO): Q3 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.07B (-5% Y/Y) inline with...

    Yahoo (YHOO): Q3 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.07B (-5% Y/Y) inline with expectations. Shares +3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q3 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $14.3B (+29% Y/Y) beats by...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q3 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $14.3B (+29% Y/Y) beats by $0.4B. Raises repurchase authorization by $10B. Shares +3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • WDC

    Sandisk (SNDK +2.4%) becomes the latest name to move on comments uttered at the Value Investing...

    Sandisk (SNDK +2.4%) becomes the latest name to move on comments uttered at the Value Investing Congress, as T2 Partners' Whitney Tilson and Glenn Tongue both say they like the flash memory vendor. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • CTRP

    Shares of China-based travel site Ctrip (CTRP -4.8%) sink after Piper Jaffray cuts its rating to...

    Shares of China-based travel site Ctrip (CTRP -4.8%) sink after Piper Jaffray cuts its rating to Neutral from Overweight and its price target to $36 from $41. CTRP should continue to capture a large portion of China's growing travel market, but given its low-end competition and near-term spending, it "will have difficulty achieving a multiple in-line with growth.”

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • DB

    European bank shares spike higher on the Guardian story that claims a deal is there to end the...

    European bank shares spike higher on the Guardian story that claims a deal is there to end the debt contagion. A sampling: Deutsche Bank (DB +5.2%), Santander (STD +3.8%), UBS (UBS +3.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • STT

    State Street (STT +9.8%) is off to the races following its Q3 beat. Goldman is reiterating a buy...

    State Street (STT +9.8%) is off to the races following its Q3 beat. Goldman is reiterating a buy on the money manager, noting its "core" EPS came in $.04 above Street forecasts. Jefferies (Hold) is a little more guarded, believing "negative EPS revision risk" exists, given State Street's current EPS run rate. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM

  • Fortune Brands Home & Security (FBHS +6%) flies after Pershing Square's Bill Ackman,...

    Fortune Brands Home & Security (FBHS +6%) flies after Pershing Square's Bill Ackman, speaking at the Value Investing Congress, says he owns the stock. The company - whose items line the aisles of your local Home Depot - was spun off from Fortune Brands and began trading on the NYSE earlier this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • APEI

    American Public Education (APEI -26%) gets hammered after the U.S. Marine Corps. says it's...

    American Public Education (APEI -26%) gets hammered after the U.S. Marine Corps. says it's cutting tuition assistance rates, sparking concerns over reduced enrollment and potential tuition cuts. The company is one of the largest providers of online postsecondary education for the military and public service communities.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • HAS

    Goldman Sachs analyst Michael Kelter downgrades shares of Hasbro (HAS -1.3%) to Neutral from...

    Goldman Sachs analyst Michael Kelter downgrades shares of Hasbro (HAS -1.3%) to Neutral from Buy, following the firm's Q3 report earlier this week. In making his rating change on the toymaker, he points to a disappointing 2011 along with a lack of clear revenue drivers for 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • CROX

    Crocs (CROX -38.8%) stock tanks, wiping out gains for the year, after the shoemaker lowered Q3...

    Crocs (CROX -38.8%) stock tanks, wiping out gains for the year, after the shoemaker lowered Q3 guidance. “A brand that’s growing 27% isn’t a brand that’s lagging in customer confidence," CEO John McCarvel says in defense, and most analysts still like the company. “This is a big overreaction," WJB Capital says. “People are equating the story to 2007, but [this] is very different."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • MANH

    Supply chain software firm Manhattan Associates (MANH +5.1%) spikes after its Q3 earnings are...

    Supply chain software firm Manhattan Associates (MANH +5.1%) spikes after its Q3 earnings are released ahead of time. While revenue of $85.6M (+16% Y/Y) is nearly in-line, EPS of $0.67 beat consensus by $0.17. In addition, the company is lifting its 2011 EPS guidance range to $2.23-$2.27, well above a $2.02 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • PRX

    Par Pharmaceutical (PRX +1.8%) is trading higher after acquiring rights to three generic...

    Par Pharmaceutical (PRX +1.8%) is trading higher after acquiring rights to three generic products from Teva Pharmaceuticals (TEVA -0.5%): fentanyl citrate lozenges, cyclobenzaprine ER capsules and the generic version of Provigil.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • BRK.A

    J.C. Penney (JPC +4.4%) adds to gains after Whitney Tilson gives it a shout at the Value...

    J.C. Penney (JPC +4.4%) adds to gains after Whitney Tilson gives it a shout at the Value Investing Congress. JCP is Tilson's 2nd largest holding after Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A). Folks buying on his recommendation should be aware Tilson hasn't exactly had a hot hand lately.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • EDU

    In addition to lower deferred revenue, New Oriental Education (EDU -10.4%) says on its...

    In addition to lower deferred revenue, New Oriental Education (EDU -10.4%) says on its conference call that its margins are going to be weakened going forward by a decline in its higher-margin customer base areas like Beijing and Shanghai, plus a shift in focus to smaller class sizes, which are growing number but also have lower margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • GS

    Goldman Sachs (GS +3.5%) adds a bit to its post-earnings gains after Eagle Capital's Boykin...

    Goldman Sachs (GS +3.5%) adds a bit to its post-earnings gains after Eagle Capital's Boykin Curry touts the bank at the Value Investing Congress. Curry expects Goldman's business to rebound once capital markets calm down, and estimates the company's current asset value to be $150/share. (more) (CC transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • KOP

    Koppers Holdings (KOP -5.7%) trades lower after First Analysis cuts it to equalweight, citing...

    Koppers Holdings (KOP -5.7%) trades lower after First Analysis cuts it to equalweight, citing concerns about the company's shift in its pitch business to the Middle East from North America. The firm also says greater long-term challenges are expected from raw material supply and consolidation of the railroad tie industry.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • SWK

    Stanley Black & Decker (NYSE:SWK) knocks out a tidy 5.4% gain after its Q3 report and...

    Stanley Black & Decker (NYSE:SWK) knocks out a tidy 5.4% gain after its Q3 report and guidance (I, II) hits the mark with investors. Though the company's estimate for Q4 EPS came in lower than earlier guidance, the market seems to be viewing the firm's $1.1B free cash flow and propensity to buy back shares in a favorable light.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • RRC

    Range Resources (RRC +1.5%) trades higher after it says Q3 natural gas production jumped 7% Y/Y...

    Range Resources (RRC +1.5%) trades higher after it says Q3 natural gas production jumped 7% Y/Y to 520M cubic feet, exceeding its previous guidance of 515M cubic feet. The better results are being driven by a jump in its Marcellus shale output, plus its infrastructure build-out proceeding faster than anticipated.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • LUV

    Airline stocks rise after the Air Transport Association says capacity continues to tighten and...

    Airline stocks rise after the Air Transport Association says capacity continues to tighten and airlines are getting more revenue from each passenger per available seat mile. Southwest (LUV +1.7%) could benefit from the improved domestic environment, but the airline says it will sell some discounted tickets in November and December. DAL +3%, UAL +1.3%, AMR +2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • VMW

    VMware's (VMW +6.4%) Q3 beat is providing a lift to 80% owner EMC (EMC +4.9%). But the market...

    VMware's (VMW +6.4%) Q3 beat is providing a lift to 80% owner EMC (EMC +4.9%). But the market also appears happy with EMC's own Q3 results, as demonstrated by the gains posted by other enterprise storage names. NTAP +2.4%. ELX +2.7%. QLGC +1.9%. BRCD +1.6%. OCZ +6%. STX +6.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • FNGN

    Financial Engines (FNGN +6.6%) moves higher today after William Blair initiates the shares with...

    Financial Engines (FNGN +6.6%) moves higher today after William Blair initiates the shares with an outperform, citing the company's market leadership position and track record of delivering solid operating results despite difficult markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • AGEN

    Agenus (AGEN +50%) skyrockets after the company reports a Phase 3 trial of GlaxoSmithKline's...

    Agenus (AGEN +50%) skyrockets after the company reports a Phase 3 trial of GlaxoSmithKline's (NYSE:GSK) malaria vaccine, which contains an Agenus drug agent, found the vaccine delivered positive results. Agenus is entitled to milestone payments for the vaccine, as well as "royalties for 10 years after commercial launch."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • FRX

    Forest Laboratories (FRX -2.7%) takes a hit after FQ2 earnings missed estimates across the...

    Forest Laboratories (FRX -2.7%) takes a hit after FQ2 earnings missed estimates across the board, thus ending a run of four consecutive quarters with Y/Y profit increases. EPS dipped 9% Y/Y due to higher overhead and R&D costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +2.1%) gains after the company uses its developer conference to unveil...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +2.1%) gains after the company uses its developer conference to unveil its BBX OS, meant to be a fusion of RIM's BlackBerry and QNX operating systems. RIM also says it plans to rely on HTML5 technology to enable apps that can simultaneously run on BBX and current BlackBerry solutions.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • DVA

    Dialysis provider DaVita (DVA +5.92%) jumps after the company raises its FY11 guidance and says...

    Dialysis provider DaVita (DVA +5.92%) jumps after the company raises its FY11 guidance and says its Q3 looks solid. Q3 EPS is expected to come in between $1.43 - $1.48 per share, well above Street estimates of $1.29, while FY11 revenue should be around $1.13B - $1.16B, up from $1.08B - $1.12B, due to improved treatment volumes and decreasing operating costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM

  • The dollar pops higher vs. the yen on today's intervention rumor out of Japan. Reuters reports...

    The dollar pops higher vs. the yen on today's intervention rumor out of Japan. Reuters reports the Japanese government and the BOJ are forming a "special team to monitor initiatives designed to address the strong yen." One greenback buys ¥76.84.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • PKG

    Packaging Corp. of America (PKG +2.8%) is trading higher after reporting mixed Q3 earnings...

    Packaging Corp. of America (PKG +2.8%) is trading higher after reporting mixed Q3 earnings yesterday. EPS dropped 55% as higher costs, a weaker sales mix and sagging prices offset volume improvement, but overall revenues beat on a 9% Y/Y improvement in net sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • PTI-OLD

    India-based outsourcing firm Patni Computer Systems (NYSE:PTI-OLD) jumps 15% after reporting...

    India-based outsourcing firm Patni Computer Systems (NYSE:PTI-OLD) jumps 15% after reporting better-than-expected Q3 results. Net profit fell 41%, but the decline was not as bad as analysts had feared. iGATE (IGTE +2.5%), which took control of Patni in a joint deal with private equity firm Apax Partners earlier this year, also trades higher on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • HD

    Shares of Home Depot (HD +2.2%) and Lowe's (LOW +1.9%) catch a bid after the NAHB report rains a...

    Shares of Home Depot (HD +2.2%) and Lowe's (LOW +1.9%) catch a bid after the NAHB report rains a bit of optimism down on the sector. Both companies stand to gain after Lowe's decided to peel back the number of stores it operates, according to analysts who call the market "saturated" after too many stores were added during the "bubble" period. The days of a LOW and HD store standing within a few blocks from each other may become a relic of the past.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • BHE

    Benchmark Electronics (BHE +2.4%) is trading higher after the company says it's begun utilizing...

    Benchmark Electronics (BHE +2.4%) is trading higher after the company says it's begun utilizing its alternate capacity in the Asia Pacific region to compensate for the recent suspension of operations in Thailand due to the floods. Although it expects that the damage to its Ayudhaya facility will have a significant impact on revenues and operations for Q4, the company is insured for both business disruption and damages.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • EDU

    New Oriental Education (EDU -12.4%) plunges following its FQ1 report. While the Chinese...

    New Oriental Education (EDU -12.4%) plunges following its FQ1 report. While the Chinese educational services firm delivered revenue and EPS that beat Street estimates, investors might be disappointed by a 10% Q/Q decline in the company's deferred revenue balance, to $174.7M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • NKE

    The bloodletting in Crocs (CROX -37.8%) continues unabated following its Q3 warning. Analyst...

    The bloodletting in Crocs (CROX -37.8%) continues unabated following its Q3 warning. Analyst Brian Sozzi thinks the warning could suggest an inventory glut, as well as growing competition from the likes of NKE, GCO, and FL. Some other names trading lower on the news: DSW -2.6%. LULU -4%. WWW -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • WHR

    Shares of Whirlpool (WHR -2.5%) get whacked with a downgrade from Goldman Sachs to Sell along...

    Shares of Whirlpool (WHR -2.5%) get whacked with a downgrade from Goldman Sachs to Sell along with a clipped price target of $42, from $55. Analysts with the firm highlight upcoming supply increases in Brazil from LG Electronics (OTC:LGEAF) and Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) as pressuring margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • ICUI

    ICU Medical (ICUI +1.99%) is trading higher after its Q3 EPS handily beat estimates, despite a...

    ICU Medical (ICUI +1.99%) is trading higher after its Q3 EPS handily beat estimates, despite a 15% jump in operating expenses. Earnings rose 3.2% Y/Y, largely due to a lower tax provision, but overall sales growth slowed on increasing global competition. The company also raises the lower end of its FY11 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • GSK

    Shares of Human Genome Sciences (HGSI +9.3%) get a pop after the rumors emerged late yesterday...

    Shares of Human Genome Sciences (HGSI +9.3%) get a pop after the rumors emerged late yesterday that GlaxoSmithKline (GSK -0.8%) is considering making a cash bid at $25 for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +5.2%) rallies after Goldman's Mark Wienkes issues a mostly bullish note, even...

    First Solar (FSLR +5.2%) rallies after Goldman's Mark Wienkes issues a mostly bullish note, even as he slashes his PT by $60. While recognizing the severe price pressure faced by solar module suppliers, Wienkes thinks First Solar has stronger demand visibility than its peers, and that the market will reward this trait in time.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • TZOO

    Shares of Travelzoo (TZOO +4.9%) get a boost after Benchmark maintains a Buy rating and $45...

    Shares of Travelzoo (TZOO +4.9%) get a boost after Benchmark maintains a Buy rating and $45 price target on shares. Analysts with the firm see a 38% Y/Y jump in revenue to $38M when the online travel operators reports Q3 results on Thursday, with its Local Deals property leading the way.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS +3%) gets a bump from Goldman Sachs upping the stock to Neutral, saying that all...

    AK Steel (AKS +3%) gets a bump from Goldman Sachs upping the stock to Neutral, saying that all the bad news has alredy been priced into the shares and there's limited downside from current levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • TOL

    Homebuilder stocks, lower yesterday on a warning from Fitch Ratings, reverse track and move...

    Homebuilder stocks, lower yesterday on a warning from Fitch Ratings, reverse track and move higher following the stronger-than-expected NAHB Housing report. Gainers: TOL +4.4%, KBH +4%, LEN +3%, MDC +3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -4.8%) is downgraded to Neutral from Overweight at JPMorgan, skeptical...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -4.8%) is downgraded to Neutral from Overweight at JPMorgan, skeptical about CHK meeting its projected price of $12K-$16K/acre for a joint venture sale of about 30% of its Utica shale in Ohio. Over the longer term, caution comes from uncertainty about CHK’s ability to fund its spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 2 Comments
  • BMI

    Shares of Badge Meter (BMI -11.8%) sink after the company misses EPS and revenue estimates with...

    Shares of Badge Meter (BMI -11.8%) sink after the company misses EPS and revenue estimates with its Q3 report. The firm reports revenue of $70M (-8% Y/Y) vs. the consensus estimate of analysts of $76.7M - negatively impacted by a "continued slowdown in spending and new projects by a number of customers in the municipal water market."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • DPZ

    Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ) tacks on a 2.3% gain after beating estimates with its Q3 report. Net...

    Domino's Pizza (NYSE:DPZ) tacks on a 2.3% gain after beating estimates with its Q3 report. Net income rose 33% Y/Y for the quarter, led by strong international sales. Revenue for stores open at least a year climbed 3% Y/Y in the U.S. and 8.1% globally.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • IBM

    IBM is down 4.3% following its Q3 report (I, II, III), as investors take profits following a...

    IBM is down 4.3% following its Q3 report (I, II, III), as investors take profits following a strong 2011 run-up. Downgrades from FBN and BMO could be making matters worse.
